ygData.subject: Re: Cleric Behaviour
ygData.msgSnippet: What 1 point of mana converts too depends on the level. The formula for mana calculation is as follows ((wis/5) +2) * level So if you at level 20, have 150
ygData.messageBody:
What 1 point of mana converts too depends on the level.
The formula for mana calculation is as follows
((wis/5) +2) * level

So if you at level 20, have 150 wisdom your mana would be

(150/5) = 30
( 30+2) = 32
(32*20) = 640

You could take this further and determine what a +5 wisdom item would be
(155/5) = 31
( 31+2) = 33
(33*20) = 660

So a +5 wisdom item added to your inventory would give you 20 more mana.
It doesnt seem like much but trust me, it does add up, esp at higher
levels.

That same +5 wisdom item at level 40 would give you 40 more mana
and at level 50, 50 more mana.


(I typed this up real quick so if my math is wrong please correct me :) ).

Mr. J Daniels


On Mon, 23 Aug 1999, Rose wrote:

> From: "Rose" <rliu@...>
>
> What?! Are there only evil clerics here? BTW I find that contradicting.
> Evil + Cleric just seems a bit ironic.
>
> For those clerics who are not fill with hate, yes, I do believe since we are
> gifted with the ability to heal we should do all we can to sustain life over
> death. However, you should manage your manna wisely.
>
>
> Another subject:
>
> Can anyone tell me how many manna 1 pt of WIS converts to?
>
> -Imogen lvl 20 Cleric from Brell
>
>
>
> > I can only concur. As a child of Hate, my only duty is to tend to
> > Innoruuk's followers to ensure his greater glory. All others are merely
> > fuel to feed his fires, like kindling.
> >
> > Vylkan, Servant of Hate
> > Tallon Zek
> >
> > > > I'm new to this mail list, and thought I would introduce
> > myself with a
> > >topic
> > > > to discuss. I've often wondered what exactly it means to be
> > a cleric in
> > > > Norrath. My personal opinion is that we should always be merciful to
> > >those
> > > > around us, and help in any way we can. Even if to heal
> > someone we don't
> > >even
> > > > know completely depletes our mana. What do you think of this?
> > >
> > >Perhaps that is what Karana asks of you.
> > >But Innoruk is the God of Hate and Pain. Pain is real. You can't
> > >avoid it. of all the gods, he is the only one honest with his followers.
> > >He WANTS us killing everything. So why should I use the powers he gives
> > >me on those who do not followhim, and will actively work against him?
>
